item.title: Dungeons of Hinterberg Review
item.description:
The massive amount of video games available in the world are so varied in their difficulty and scope, there seems to be something to make almost everyone happy. From those requiring a lot of dedication to mastering, to those proud of their ease at being able to pick up and play, Dungeons of Hinterberg perches itself squarely on the side of the casual side of gaming, but that doesn't make it uninteresting.

Indeed, developer Microbird Games offers an enjoyable, though slow-paced, mixture of exploration, combat, and puzzle-solving that won't challenge the hardest of the hard-core, but embraces its casual side with open arms and open mind. There are a few design decisions and its ease of use choices that players who have been gaming a long time won't like, but it still manages to create a story and atmosphere that is worthy of some attention from adventure game fans.

Set in the picturesque town of Hinterberg, the game quickly introduces players to the central gameplay loop of their "slaycation" that will rule their day-to-day activities. Story progression in the morning, exploration of either dungeons or the wide open maps of the various areas as they unlock at noon, followed by the purchasing of supplies and/or hanging out with various denizens of the town to raise various stats at night. Some story beats also take place in the evenings, but Dungeons of Hinterberg seems to pride itself on letting players choose how fast they wish to progress.

Those not interested in the story can choose to explore, and those not caring about exploring all the nooks and crannies can run from dungeon to dungeon and complete them as quickly as they want. There is some slowdown with higher level dungeons if players are under-geared, as they'll find themselves doing minimal damage in combat to the point it seems almost pointless to keep trying. The story does require dungeon completion to progress at certain points, but luckily those are some of the shorter dungeons.

The casual approach also makes its way into the game's combat, as the standard light and heavy attacks seem to be the two main sources of damage throughout much of the game. There are spells to learn that are specific to certain areas and can only be used there or while in the dungeons whose entrances are on the same map. They can be used in combat too, though some, like a giant bomb, add a lot more firepower than others. There are also a pair of ability slots that allow users to pick and choose various attacks that cause damage and status effects, like knockdowns.

Most users will likely find a specific pair they feel is useful and never change them. But even with all the extra abilities and spells, the 1-2 combo of light and heavy attacks (along with a dodge roll) will be the players' bread and butter for the vast majority of combat.

Fighting itself is activated when coming close to enemies or being ambushed, and takes place within an inescapable ring. If there are three or fewer enemies, combat is very straightforward and usually not too difficult. Four or more can become challenging as some spell-casting enemies can fill up the combat area rather quickly. Enemy design isn't terribly interesting, as most appear as inky black creatures, though some boss enemies have a bit of uniqueness to their looks and attacks.

The mix of cel-shading and heavy outlines makes for an interesting visual experience, but the lack of details in NPC faces can sometimes feel like a bit of a let down when viewing. The various areas players will explore are gorgeous, with plenty of strange and colorful flora and rocks found throughout the game. Ground clutter and the various skyboxes are pretty, but some of the character models' faces look almost too basic for the game they appear in. Another misstep that looks and feels out of place was the choice by Microbird Games to not allow destructible items within the dungeons unless they're integral to a puzzle. So, spare crates, boxes, etc., are all just static items within the dungeon itself. This also means that finding items is almost too easy, as they merely appear as floating lights scattered on the ground.

It can feel odd to not have to search very hard to find these items in an adventure game, but it also means players won't miss many things, as they can be seen from a fairly good distance away. This occurs on the larger explorable maps as well, though on these maps the items can sometimes encourage extra exploration to find exactly how to get to them. It was a deliberate design choice, but for long-time gamers, it may feel a bit odd not being able to destroy things while in a dungeon.

Players looking for a more difficult challenge in puzzle solving will not find it in Dungeons of Hinterberg . Almost every puzzle uses the skills learned for that area, and almost every choice is obvious. For example, the first explorable area in Dungeons of Hinterberg gives the player a large bomb and a ball and chain that can be thrown at objects to activate them. With these, most of the puzzles end up being focused around destroying rock formations with the larger bomb or using the ball and chain to raise the platforms the larger bomb is sitting on, etc. Though the lack of challenging puzzles isn't inherently a bad thing, users wishing for a mental challenge will undoubtedly be disappointed with the end result. There are a few larger puzzles that can take a bit of exploration to figure out, but even in these cases, the answer becomes obvious fairly quickly.

Items, weapons, and charms are mostly the standard fantasy affair, as well as the usual method of finding more powerful weapons within dungeons to equip or buying them in the town's shops. The twist here is that certain items don't show their full ability or power until the player has reached certain levels in stats that are usually only leveled up by hanging out with certain citizens in town. Some will raise a player's Reknown level, others might raise their Amusement or Relaxation levels, and some raise three or more at a slower rate.

Unlocking a weapon's true potential can take time, with the main downside being that there are moments when players will have already progressed past the weapon's fully unlocked usefulness before it's even able to be used at full power. It forces choices that seem to go against its more casual aspects by pigeonholing users into hanging out with people merely to improve weapons that may or may not be helpful in the long run.

Dungeons of Hinterberg does a lot of things right. It features a story that shows the protagonist growing within themselves, albeit slowly, and embraces its casual atmosphere with wide-open arms. Players that enjoy that slower side of gaming will find some interesting moments while exploring and playing through the story. The rest will have to find something buried in the game's combat to keep their interest, though that may prove too difficult. Still, those players looking for something easy that never moves too fast and ambles on at a comfortable pace will enjoy Dungeons of Hinterberg for the qualities it fully embraces.

Dungeons of Hinterberg is available now on PC and Xbox Series X|S. Game Rant was provided a PC code for this review.

item.title: 7 Fighting Games With The Best Character Customization
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fighting games now offer diverse character customization options, enabling players to create unique avatars in games like Jump Force.
  • Wrestling game WWE 2K16 provides a robust creation studio for players to design their ultimate wrestler, enhancing the gaming experience.
  • Soulcalibur 5 stands out with its extensive character creator, allowing players to customize everything from appearance to equipment.

There’s something really exciting about having a unique created character which the player can use within a game. There are several games that have this feature in deep detail. However, for the longest time, fighting games did not have anything of this sort.

As the years have passed, fighting games have made more of an effort to add customization options, enabling players to enjoy the game as they want. The normal expectation of a fighting game would be something shallow, but, there are a set of games that have gone the extra mile to give fans and players all the tools needed to create the character of their dreams.

7 Jump Force

Not The Best Fighting Game, But Features Some Really Cool Customization Options

Jump Force had all the elements to be a huge fighting game. It had access to a huge roster of characters from beloved manga and anime series, the backing of Bandai Namco, who already have several successful fighting games like Tekken and Dragon Ball FighterZ to their name, and a lot of hype leading up to its release.

It didn’t turn out well, as the game was imbalanced and suffered from poor writing. However, something they did really well was the character customization. Players could customize their characters as they wished, with mostly anime esthetics available, but it was varied. While not enough to save the game, it is certainly worth trying just because of how cool players can make their character look.

6 WWE 2K16

A Robust Creation Studio For The Perfect Career

There might be some controversy over selecting a wrestling game as a fighting game. While fighting game purists might disagree, wrestling games are best placed within the fighting game genre. In WWE 2K16 , the player can choose to either start creating a character from scratch, or pick from existing designs.

If players go with the former, they are provided with a wide array of customization tools to create the ultimate wrestler. From piercings to face masks, players can go with anything. The only drawback is that there are some cosmetic changes locked behind in-game tasks, which can be a bit of a pain.

5 Mortal Kombat: Armageddon

One Of Earliest Examples Of Character Creation Done Right

Mortal Kombat: Armageddon was released in 2006, and was the sequel to the very popular MK: Deception . Armageddon was a turning point for the MK series, as it was the last entry in the original timeline of the franchise. What came after was the rebooted Mortal Kombat, known as MK9 .

Released on the PS2, Mortal Kombat : Armageddon had a great character customization system. Sure, the graphics were not perfect, and the cosmetic selections weren’t massive, but it was quite impressive for its time. Players had the option of changing their face and even picking different races, like vampires or tarkatan.

4 Smack Studio

Create A Character From Scratch

​​​​​​

  • Platform : Microsoft Windows
  • Engine : Unreal Engine 4
  • Release Date : 20 September 2021
  • Genres : Fighting, Indie, Platformer
  • Developer : ThirdPixel Interactive
  • Publisher : ThirdPixel Interactive

Smack Studio is an indie game made by ThirdPixel Interactive and available on Microsoft and Steam. The game was made for players who enjoy the character creation process. Smack Studio was released in 2021 and takes inspiration from other popular platform fighters like Super Smash Bros . and Brawlhalla .

Players can create a character from scratch, meaning there is no need to rely on a wide variety of templates available within the game. Players can also create stages, and the editor is so in-depth that even people who want to go into game development could learn a thing or two. This is a great indie game, with the potential for longevity.

3 Def Jam: Fight For NY

The Character Creation Option Elevated The Game

Def Jam : Fight For NY was the sequel to the first, highly-popular Def Jam game. It is another of those games that dwells in the gray area of its definition as a fighting game. Fight For NY built on a lot of the things the first game did well, and it really upped the ante on the character creation front.

The player could start the story mode with a new character, and the means by which the character is created is perhaps one of the most creative things about the game. The player's avatar sits down with a sketch artist and then starts creating the character through the creation of the artist's drawing, which is pretty cool. The options aren’t as plentiful as some would like, but it was an impressive feat for the time.

2 Street Fighter 6

The Latest Capcom Fighter Produces The Best Creative Content

Street Fighter 6 is the latest in the Street Fighter franchise. Released in 2023, it has gone on to become the top fighting game in the world. Among the many new elements added to the game, it also features a character creation system which the player can use to create the character they would like to play as in World Tour Mode.

The character creation options are comprehensive, with players able to create both the most grotesque abominations or the most beautiful and human-like avatars. The only drawback is the lack of accessories. While the avatar can look any way the creator wants, they can’t quite dress the way the player might like.

1 Soulcalibur 5

Arguably The Best Example Of Character Creation In A Fighting Game

Soulcalibur 5 was not the strongest entry in the series, but thankfully, it presented an awesome character creator that made up for many of the game’s other failings. Soulcalibur 6 also has impressive character creation, but it locks players out of some options based on the race of the character they're designing.

In Soulcalibur 5, no such restriction exists, and players are free to not only build their character in any way they want, but also to design their equipment, with a wide variety of items, weapons, and so on available to be edited. The game enabled players to customize hair, height, weight, and so many other things, and if one were to speak to fans, they would always point at Soulcalibur’s 5 creation options as one of its strongest points.

item.title: 10 Best Soulslikes If You Want To Fight With Sabres
item.description:
The mark of a good soulslike is its combat system. Many of these games feature a substantial library of weapons for players to try, offering many avenues for fans to find a playstyle that suits them best. In the inhospitable and dangerous worlds that these soulslikes present, it's important to have faith in one's weapon.

Sabres are a reliable weapon archetype that fans can find in numerous soulslike titles. These single-bladed, often curved weapons offer a bit more speed and mobility than one usually gets from a more traditional straight sword. These soulslikes have excellent curved blades for fans who are interested in wielding a sabre.

10 Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice

A Samurai's Best Friend

The katana is one of the most iconic forms of sabre out there, and there's no better soulslike for katana gameplay than Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice . This action-oriented title differs from the standard Soulsborne formula in a number of ways, but especially in its eschewing of the wide array of weapons offered in similar titles. While Sekiro's prosthetic arm can be upgraded with a variety of tools, the katana is the only main weapon on offer.

The upside of this is that the gameplay has been designed fully with the protagonist's katana in mind, making it a satisfying and fleshed-out weapon. The game's complex parry system keeps duels with bosses fast, engaging, and brutal, and the high speed that makes sabres such an appealing choice to begin with is on full display.

9 Lies of P

Customizable Cleavers

2023's surprise hit Lies of P takes an unconventional approach to its weapon system. In keeping with the mechanical nature of the game's world, this macabre Pinocchio retelling lets players freely mix and match weapon blades and hilts, creating unique tools with properties that suit any occasion.

Using this broad system of customization, players can build some truly vicious sabres. Combat in Lies of P takes heavy inspiration from Bloodborne , meaning it's naturally quite fast-paced. This makes it an ideal environment for sabres, and the game has many to offer.

8 Bloodborne

Sharp Knives For The Hunt

The unique gothic horror world of Bloodborne comes with a wide array of strange new weapons to master. The hunters of Yharnam use distinct trick weapons to conquer the bloody beasts prowling the night. These strange weapons can transform at the push of a button into strange new forms, with new advantages and disadvantages to master.

Conventional weaponry is hard to come by in Bloodborne , but there are still some good sabres for fans who want to carve up a beast or two. Eileen the Crow's iconic Blades of Mercy are a particularly noteworthy example, letting players who complete her questline slash monsters with vicious dual-wielding techniques.

7 Dark Souls

Preparing To Die

The original Dark Souls set the standard for many of the things that would become tradition throughout the genre. Weapon variety is one of its most prominent contributions. The game has seven varieties of sword, and curved swords and katanas are both represented in the lineup. These lightweight, speedy sabres would set the standard for many weapons to come.

Only seven curved swords and four katanas are present in the original Dark Souls , but there are still some excellent options in this relatively small selection. One of the most prominent sabres in the game is the Gold Tracer, gifted to players in the DLC. When paired with the matching dagger, the Dark Silver Tracer, these weapons make a formidable and deadly duo.

6 Demon's Souls

Choosing The Right Reaper

Demon's Souls may not have had quite as much cultural impact as its successor, but it still paved the way for a special game genre that persists to this day. Like the Dark Souls trilogy that would follow it, Demon's Souls also has more than its fair share of deadly and powerful weapons for players to experiment with.

This game boasts six curved swords and three katanas for players who favor a quick, vicious, sabre-style approach to combat. While there are very few katanas in the game, each one inflicts the bleed status on enemies, making them particularly effective choices against foes who are weak to that ailment.

5 Dark Souls 2

The Sequel Adds More Toys to Play With

Dark Souls 2 made some substantial changes to the Dark Souls formula, which have received mixed responses ever since. In a less controversial move, however, it also doubled down on weapon variety. The game introduced a much broader arsenal of tools to fight with, expanding options for dual-wielding playstyles, and making boss weapons more accessible.

Sabres were just a few of the beneficiaries of this updated system. With ten curved swords and eight katanas on offer, players who want to strike fast with their blades have numerous options to choose from. Katanas can even be used to parry attacks when placed in the offhand, opening up plenty of tactical decisions for builds.

4 Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty

Slicing Through Ancient China

Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty takes place during the fall of the Han Dynasty in ancient China, and its weapon system reflects this historical period with remarkable dedication. The game lacks many of the traditional European weapons associated with games like Dark Souls , but in its place, it offers a wealth of sabre offerings.

For the swift-footed warrior, Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty offers curved sabres, dual sabres, and even straight sabres, which lets sabre fans simulate a more traditional approach to swordplay. There are, of course, more standard straight swords as well, but the straight sabres forgo those weapons' thrusting attacks in favor of wide, swift slashes.

3 Dark Souls 3

The Biggest Arsenal In the Trilogy

As the culmination of the legendary Dark Souls trilogy, Dark Souls 3 builds on almost every element from the first two games. This is especially true for the game's weapon catalog, which is truly immense. Dark Souls 3 boasts 15 curved swords and 8 katanas, giving sabre fans plentiful options.

Even better, several of the curved sword options in Dark Souls 3 come as part of a paired set. These special paired weapons give fans access to a brutal and relentless new moveset. Dark Souls 3 also added special abilities to many of its new weapons, adding even more tools to a sabre fan's arsenal.

2 Nioh 2

So Many Swords

Nioh 2 takes place in the Sengoku period of Ancient Japan, and as such, there are plenty of katanas to fight with. Fans of sabre-style weaponry will be especially pleased with this game, as the swift, curved blade common in weapons of this type is the norm in Nioh 2 . Straighter swords do show up in the game, but they're much less common.

The game features a blistering 52 swords, most of which are curved, as well as 39 sets of paired blades to add further depth to a sabre fan's loadout. Nioh 2 does have a reputation for intense difficulty, but with this many swords to choose from, players will have plenty of options for taking on this unforgiving title.

1 Elden Ring

A World Full Of Blades

The legendary Elden Ring is the largest soulslike From Software has yet produced, and with that scale comes a truly unprecedented variety of weapons. This game boasts a staggering forty weapon types, including the eight varieties added in Shadow of the Erdtree . As in the Dark Souls games, players can choose from a wide array of curved swords and katanas if they favor a sabre. Elden Ring famously includes Rivers of Blood, an infamously powerful katana that can chop down enemies in a matter of seconds.

The Shadow of the Erdtree DLC added some new weapon categories that should be of interest to sabre fans as well. The new backhand blades are a versatile and mobility-focused class of weapons that give players many new options for combat, and great katanas let fans enjoy some of the speed of a katana while adding a bit more punch to each swing.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Changli Team Composition Guide
item.description:
Changli

Fusion

Sword

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Team Compositions

Changli, is the latest Fusion Sword character in Wuthering Waves , serves both as a main DPS and sub-DPS. Her high damage output and need for extended field time make her a strategic choice for players that enjoy characters that stay on the field longer, since she best benefits from being on-field for her effectiveness, despite having some buffs for team members when off-field through her outro skill as well.

Building an optimal team around Changli is crucial as it is with many other DPS oriented characters. As a character, who can take both a main DPS and sub DPS role, she excels in dealing significant damage and supporting the team - especially in team compositions that can benefit from duo DPS setups. However, it's worth noting that, she currently lacks perfect synergetic team members, and she might be a more fully fledged solo DPS with the release of future characters. Nevertheless, there are still some characters that show good synergy. This guide will showcase three different team compositions without repeating characters, providing various strategies to maximize Changli’s potential.

Characters like Taoqi and Mortefi can also be effective but are not included in the main recommendations.

Changli + Encore + Verina

  • Changli: Main DPS / Sub-DPS / Buffer
  • Encore: Main DPS
  • Verina: Support

When it comes to the most straightforward team composition, Verina and Encore are top choices. Verina is currently the best support character in Wuthering Waves, as she can buff all team members, including both Encore and Changli, while taking minimal field time. This allows Changli to maximize her on-field presence. With the correct rotation, Changli can enhance Encore with the Fusion DMG bonus from her outro skill, even though she cannot use the Resonance Liberation DMG buff. For players who intend to keep Changli on the field for long durations, this setup works well. Encore can be swapped in primarily for her DPS output during her Resonance Liberation state, especially with a high Energy Regen stat, and then swapped out to reduce her field time. It is also possible to use both on the field for relatively equal times if preferred.

This team composition consists entirely of 5-star characters. However, since both Encore and Verina are available from the standard pull, players should have relatively easy access to them.

Changli + Chixia + Baizhi

  • Changli: Main DPS / Sub-DPS / Buffer
  • Chixia: Main DPS / Sub-DPS
  • Baizhe: Support

For players who don't have an invested Encore or are using Verina in another team composition, such as in Tower of Adversity, Chixia and Baizhe offer a viable F2P alternative alongside Changli. In this setup, Chixia can benefit from Changli's Fusion DMG buff and Resonance Liberation DMG bonus, which significantly enhance her damage output due to high modifiers and Forte Chains. Although Chixia's overall damage might be lower than Encore's, well-timed rotations with Changli's outro buffs can still yield impressive results. Additionally, as a ranged unit, Chixia offers versatility in various combat scenarios.

For the support role, while Verina is generally superior, Baizhe can serve as a healer. However, her outro buff requires careful management, as it only affects the next character. In this setup, it is most effective to use Baizhe’s outro buff on Changli for a smoother field setup.

Changli + Jinhsi + Yuanwu

  • Changli: Main DPS / Sub-DPS / Buffer
  • Jinhsi: Main DPS
  • Yuanwu: Support

Utilizing Changli and Jinhsi in the same team composition offers unique synergy, especially when leveraging their outro and intro skills to their fullest. Changli's outro buff enhances Jinhsi’s DPS by boosting her Resonance Liberation and accelerating her Resonance Skill progression. This setup allows Jinhsi to reach her skill's final stage more quickly. Both characters excel in a quick-swap strategy: Changli can rapidly build Incandescence stacks for Jinhsi due to their different elements, while maxed Incandescence stacks help Changli enter True Sight faster due to Jinhsi's kit, optimizing their combined rotations.

In this composition, Yuanwu serves as a valuable addition, requiring minimal on-field time. His role is crucial for efficiently building Incandescence stacks with Jinhsi and providing support through shield generation. Although the team lacks a dedicated healer, Yuanwu’s shields and his ability to reduce the enemy’s stun bar help mitigate the risks of not having constant healing while creating openings for maximum DPS. This setup emphasizes careful dodging and timing between quick swaps, but it can be highly effective with proper execution.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Changli Build Guide
item.description:
Changli

Fusion

Sword

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Team Compositions

Changli, introduced in the 1.1 update of Wuthering Waves , is a versatile DPS character who can perform as both a main DPS and sub-DPS. As a Fusion Sword character, Changli brings unique strengths and synergies to the team, making her a valuable asset in various compositions.

Luckily, regardless of whether she's used as main DPS or sub-DPS, players can build her essentially the same way, allowing them to test her out in different team compositions and find fun rotations and unique team members if they wish to do so. Here's the main aspects to focus on when building her, including her best weapons, echoes as well as forte priority.

Changli Best Build In Wuthering Waves

Weapons

Echo Set

Echoes Stat

  1. Blazing Brilliance
  2. Emerald of Genesis
  3. Commando of Conviction
  4. Lumingloss
  5. Lunar Cutter

Main Echo

  • Inferno Rider

Echo Sets

  • 5pc Molten Rift
  • 2pc Molten Rift + 2pc Lingering Tunes
  • 5pc Lingering Tunes

  • 4-Cost: Crit Rate or Crit DMG
  • 3-Cost: Fusion DMG / ATK %
  • 3-Cost: Fusion DMG / ATK%
  • 1-Cost: ATK
  • 1-Cost: ATK

Sub Stat Priority : Crit Rate / Crit DMG > Resonance Skill >Energy Regen > ATK%

Changli Best Echoes In Wuthering Waves

When it comes to Echoes, Changli is built quite similarly to Encore or Chixia. Her best Echo set is undoubtedly the 5-piece Molten Rift set with Inferno Rider as the main Echo. This set is highly effective as it focuses on increasing Fusion DMG, which is further amplified by the 5-piece set bonus, enhancing Fusion DMG even more when the Resonance Skill is used. Considering that Changli uses her Resonance Skill frequently in her rotation, she can maintain this buff consistently.

For players who haven't been lucky in obtaining this Echo set with ideal main and sub-stats, especially in the early game, mixing it with a 2-piece Lingering Tunes set is a viable option. This combination provides more ATK, which Changli needs in high amounts to deal significant damage. As a last resort, even a full 5-piece Lingering Tunes set is quite viable, especially if planning to use her as the main DPS in combination with other main DPS characters such as Jinshi. However, it is worth noting that Changli cannot benefit from the Outro Skill DMG buff of Lingering Tunes, as her Outro Skill provides a buff for Fusion DMG and Resonance Liberation DMG. Still, if the stats of the Lingering Tunes set are significantly better than the best Molten Rift pieces players have, it can still be an effective choice.

Molten Rift

  • 2pc : Fusion DMG +10%.
  • 5pc : Upon using Resonance Skill, Fusion DMG +30% for 15s.

Lingering Tunes

  • 2pc : ATK +10%.
  • 5pc : While on the field, ATK +5% every 1.5s, up to 4 times. Outro Skill DMG increases by 60%.

For the rest of the Echoes setup, players should be using a 4-3-3-1-1 combination, with the 3-cost Echoes focusing on Fusion DMG or ATK% and the 1-star Echoes having ATK% as the main stat. If players have been unable to obtain good pieces from the 3-cost Echoes, a 4-4-1-1-1 setup can also work, though it is less ideal as it misses out on a significant amount of Fusion DMG.

For substats, it's ideal to focus on the usual DPS build setups, which include Crit values, ATK, and Energy Regen, much like Encore. However, a significant difference is that instead of focusing on Basic ATK, Changli benefits from Resonance Skill substats, since a lot of her kit's DMG counts as Resonance Skill DMG. The need for this can be minimized if players opt for her signature weapon, which provides additional Resonance Skill bonus.

Changli Best Weapons In Wuthering Waves

In terms of weapons, Changli's signature weapon, Blazing Brilliance, is ideal as it significantly boosts Crit DMG, Resonance Skill, and ATK%. However, it’s worth noting that players will need to spend a decent amount of time on-field with Changli to max out the weapon’s stacks and benefit from the full effect before the stacks reset.

If players do not have her signature weapon, Emerald of Genesis is a viable 5-star alternative. Conveniently available at level 45 in Union Level, it is one of the recommended 5-star options to pick from the standard banner, as it also benefits characters like Havoc or Spectro Rover. In end-game content like Tower of Adversity, players can swap around weapons and echoes between characters used in different towers, which can be handy for resource management.

Additionally, there are several 4-star weapon options that can work well, including Commando of Conviction, Lumingloss, and Lunar Cutter, providing viable alternatives for players without access to the 5-star weapons, especially considering that there aren't many options to go for.

Changli Forte Priority In Wuthering Waves

Considering that resource management can be quite taxing on players when building multiple characters, it's recommended to focus on upgrading the Forte that will bring the most value in terms of DMG. That being said, the order should be as follows:

  1. Forte Circuit
  2. Resonance Skill
  3. Resonance Liberation
  4. Basic Attack
  5. Intro Skill
